channel.title: Client Image Help
channel.description:
My client uses the image compression method of .jag i know i can rename it to png and edit it that way, but renaming it back doesnt put it back in the real .jag format, for one it doesnt keep the colors when you rename such as a invisible background, it makes it all white, what can i do to fix this, maybe edit my client to accept images in png format instead of jag or maybe just compress this one image back into .jag.
Any help is appreciated. Thanks, -deershoot3r

item.title: Client Image Help
item.dc:creator: @nsfpure nsfpure
item.description:
@nsfpure wrote:

No sorry . Its a fairly light pink

Read full topic

@deershoot3r wrote:

do you by any chance know the hex code for the exact pink color used?

@nsfpure wrote:

Use pink backgrounds instead of clear

My client uses the image compression method of .jag i know i can rename it to png and edit it that way, but renaming it back doesnt put it back in the real .jag format, for one it doesnt keep the colors when you rename such as a invisible background, it makes it all white, what can i do to fix this, maybe edit my client to accept images in png format instead of jag or maybe just compress this one image back into .jag.
